| website = http://www.city.aizuwakamatsu.fukushima.jp/ | footnotes = }} is a city in the Aizu region of Fukushima Prefecture, Japan. ==Education== ===Universities and colleges=== *University of Aizu *Junior Collage of Aizu ==Sister cities== ===Japanese sister cities=== * Mutsu, Aomori (Since September 23, 1984) * Naruto, Tokushima (Since October 30, 1999) * Ina, Nagano (Since September 24, 2000) * Yokosuka, Kanagawa (Since April 17, 2005) ===International sister cities=== * Jingzhou (Since June 15, 1991) * Saipan (Since September 22, 2006) ==References== ==Other websites== * Aizuwakamatsu
